title: Stewed Cannellini Beans with Chiles and Thyme
directions: Bring beans, onion, fennel, carrot, garlic, thyme sprigs, chiles de árbol, ⅓ cup oil, and 8 cups water to a simmer in a large pot over medium. Reduce heat to bring liquid to a gentle simmer and cook until beans are creamy all the way through, 50–65 minutes. Season generously with salt. Serve beans topped with pepper and a drizzle of oil.
Do Ahead: Beans can be cooked 3 days ahead. Let cool in cooking liquid; cover and chill.
ingredients: 1 pound dried cannellini (white kidney) beans, soaked overnight, drained
1 medium fennel bulb, halved through root end
2 dried chiles de árbol or ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
⅓ cup olive oil, plus more for serving
